subject: Triathlon
lead_paragraph: Authorities said a 32-year-old man who died during the New York City Triathlon last summer was killed by a condition linked to high blood pressure. Esteban Neira died in the Hudson River during the swim portion of the triathlon July 20. The cause was initially a mystery. After further testing, the medical examiner ruled that the cause of death was hypertensive cardiovascular disease. John Korff, a triathlon organizer, said Neira, from Argentina, apparently was unaware he had the condition.
